meanings.definition: The act of dispelling false beliefs or misconceptions.
meanings.sent1: The disabusal of myths about dragons helped people understand they were not real creatures.
meanings.sent2: She provided disabusal by explaining that the Earth is round, not flat.
meanings.sent3: The disabusal that aliens built the pyramids made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His disabusal of the idea that eating carrots gives you night vision was eye-opening.
meanings.sent5: The disabusal of the superstition that black cats bring bad luck was liberating.

meanings.definition: The process of correcting someone's mistaken ideas or beliefs.
meanings.sent1: After the disabusal, he finally understood that sugar doesn't make kids hyper.
meanings.sent2: The disabusal of the misconception that all snakes are poisonous was enlightening.
meanings.sent3: Her disabusal that eating crusts will make your hair curly was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The disabusal of the notion that lightning never strikes the same place twice was a shock.
meanings.sent5: The disabusal of the belief that goldfish have a 3-second memory was eye-opening.
